title: How much land required to build a house? - Quora

response.answer_text: It all depends on the requirement of accommodation of family members-so the family size. additionally the availability of funds or loans from a bank or LIC. The construction cost varies as per one’s choice of material. fittings, facilities etc. third is the availability of land at a price which comes in the budget. For example, if a comfortable Indian House is to be built for say two -three-generation then 25% of the land can be left open for garden and passages separating the neighbors building. This is essential for getting Sunlight and fresh air. Our house is in a govt. plot of land of about 3000sq.ft. size. but we have a garden space- which can be used as parking of about 700 sq.ft. then we have 4ft. passages on the two sides. so the built-up area is around 2000 sq. ft and having three bedrooms an inner courtyard and a drawing room with two bathrooms kitchen and a dining space. we are middle-class people so we could invest only a sum of about 20–30 lakhs about 10 years back. so pl. consult a good architect and try to have the best as per your comfort.

Depends upon requirement of accommodation like no of bed rooms and it's sizes, type and number of toilets and it's Sizes, area of kitchen, lobby, passage, whether garage is required for covered parking and last but not the least setback area. Typically a house requires 60′ x 30′ = 1800 Sq.Ft. of land area for constructing a 2 BHK decent house with setback on just 2 sides (front and rear)
